column4: maybe I should ask this, I'm looking for binutils or binutils-dev <=2.20.1 how do I manage that? # apt-get install binutils-dev=2.20.1 \ Reading package lists... Done \ Building dependency tree \ Reading state information... Done \ E: Version '2.20.1' for 'binutils-dev' was not found
Yes. You want !pin
Sorry, no. !=pinning, holding, or backports.
binutils for 10.10 is version 2.20.51
Apparently synaptic have older version options. Try that.
what do you mean "older version options" I think maybe I need a different repos.
http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=6095488&postcount=4
what part of !=backports (because it doesn't mean old)??
That's for updated stuffs such as modules, firmware.
every article you've pointed me to talks about going forward. Dude, 51 > 1. Help me find an old repos, or tell me to build, none of pinning, holding, backports, or any of this is applicable.
Meh. Try packages.
You could find older packages online -- Maybe.
I know because I just tried all of them, I have 94 repos. hits and yet as I am in 10.10 I am stuck in the future.
Why are you trying to go back to old binutils?
using 10.10 as host to build LFS
http://packages.ubuntu.com/lucid/binutils
A true linux does not have distro. You could use that version, I presume.

I think that's how I'll have to go. outside distro for at least some things... I don't know. I think I would need different repos. to get most of those, right? like some from Debian actual deb or that?
Backtrack are based on Ubuntu.
Thought it was more Knoppix
